paragraphs.text: ECMiner™ is a data analytics software developed by ECMiner Co., Ltd. Most of the features of ECMiner™ are pull-down menus easily accessible to non-technical users. Academics with expertise in analytical algorithms collaborated in the early days of the development ECMiner™. Subsequent versions are developed for providing a variety of data management, transforming, and model evaluation for real-world problems.

runs.text: are pull-down menus easily accessible to non-technical users. Academics with expertise in analytical algorithms collaborated in the early days of the development
. Subsequent versions are developed for providing a variety of data management, transforming, and model evaluation for real-world problems.

paragraphs.text: The key advantage of ECMiner™ is the following:
It supports various types of database formats, ECL (a proprietary data structure), TEXT, EXCEL, etc. Large volumes of data are manageable.

runs.text: It supports various types of database formats, ECL (a proprietary data structure), TEXT, EXCEL,
Large volumes of data are manageable.

paragraphs.text: The options are organized into menu tabs, and when a tab is selected, an editing window appears. The options that can be set include General Program Settings, Default Database Setting, and Editing Frequently Used Nodes, among others.

runs.text: The options are organized into menu tabs, and when a tab is selected, an editing window appears. The options that can be set include General Program Settings, Default Database Setting, and Editing Frequently Used Nodes, among others.

paragraphs.text: The dialog is divided into tabs for these menus, allowing for selective settings according to the relevant option.

paragraphs.text: When you select the Program Settings under Tool(T) - Option(O), the following options window will appear. In this options window, you can set the Data/Time Format by country, the recognition method for numerical data, designate File Extensions to Display on the Resource window, and the Program Look method.

runs.text: When you select the Program Settings under Tool(T) - Option(O), the following options window will appear. In this options window, you can set the Data/Time Format by country, the recognition method for numerical data, designate File Extensions to Display on the Resource window, and the Program Look method.

paragraphs.text: Selecting Default Database Setting from Tool (T) - Option (O) opens the following options window. The databases supported by ECMiner™ are ODBC and OLE DB. By entering the driver and login information in the options window below, it can be set as the default database information for database operations in the Project window, making it convenient to use.

runs.text: Selecting Default Database Setting from Tool (T) - Option (O) opens the following options window. The databases supported by ECMiner™ are ODBC and OLE DB. By entering the driver and login information in the options window below, it can be set as the default database information for database operations in the Project window, making it convenient to use.

paragraphs.text: Selecting Edit Frequently Used Nodes (Favorites) from Tool (T) - Option (O) brings up the following options window. Use the function buttons to add or remove nodes from Most used nodes. Added or removed nodes can be checked in the Most used nodes tab of the Node window.

runs.text: Selecting Edit Frequently Used Nodes (Favorites) from Tool (T) - Option (O) brings up the following options window. Use the function buttons to add or remove nodes from Most used nodes. Added or removed nodes can be checked in the Most used nodes tab of the Node window.

Node for ‘Data’, ‘Chart’, “Modeling’, ‘Output’ and ‘Model Evaluation’. Data loading (data input), data manipulation to filter, derive variables and define indep. & dep. variables.

The resource window displays with Local, Model, and Output. Local displays the list of the current working folder. Model stores the current data analytical node. Output stores the results of executing the current project.
The window displays the contents of the selected menu (Local, Model, Output) in the Resource menu.

NOTE Since the output of the Display Node is generated as data, it should be saved as a data file(*.ecl) rather than as an output file (*.ept). Therefore, you must use the save button within the Display Node screen to save the output. [image:rId121]

Choose this option if you want to treat all numerical data as floating-point numbers when reading data.

Specify the types of files to be displayed in the Resource window. Enter the file extensions you want to display, separated by ";". Extensions like ecm, ecl, ept, gms, etc., are selected by default even if not specified.
Specify the overall look of the program. Set it to a form that is visually pleasing to the user.
Specify the display format for floating-point numbers when presenting data on screen or in reports.
